A Letter From Claudette

Founder's Note — Vol. VII, Spring Issue

In 2019, I was sitting in a steam room at the Fairmont in Scottsdale when I experienced what I can only describe as a molecular reckoning. The humidity was 97%. I was 97% sure of everything. My entire body understood something that my Harvard MBA never taught me: moisture is the medium through which the soul communicates.

I resigned from my position as VP of Human Resources at Lockheed Martin the next morning. My husband asked why I was packing a hygrometer. I told him I was going to save corporate America. He filed for divorce eleven days later. He was a 22% man. I should have known.

"If you've ever trusted someone who keeps their thermostat below 68°F, you've already felt the cost of ignoring atmospheric data."

The science is not complicated. Humans evolved in tropical environments at 70–80% relative humidity. The further a person strays from that range in their comfort preferences, the further they stray from their own humanity. This is not metaphor. This is psychrometrics.THE STUDY OF ATMOSPHERIC MOISTURE

I have now assessed over 4,100 executives across 23 countries. The correlation between preferred humidity and ethical decision-making is 0.94. For context, the correlation between smoking and lung cancer is 0.87. Make of that what you will.

Every Fortune 500 bankruptcy in the last decade was led by someone who preferred humidity below 35%. Every single one. I checked.

Frequently Raised Concerns

Is this real science? +

We have published 14 papers in the Journal of Atmospheric Personality Studies, which we founded. Peer review is conducted by our senior partners. The methodology is airtight, which is actually the problem — we prefer permeable environments.

What if my CEO is a Desert Affect? +

This is more common than you think. 61% of S&P 500 CEOs score below 35% RH. We recommend our Emergency Desiccation Response package. In extreme cases, Claudette will personally sit outside their office with a commercial-grade humidifier until behavioral change is observed.

Can humidity preference change over time? +

Rarely. Humidity preference is formed by age 4 and is more stable than political affiliation. However, we have documented 23 cases of "moisture awakening" — typically triggered by international travel, divorce, or prolonged exposure to a really good shower head.

My HR department says this is pseudoscience and potentially discriminatory. +

What is their preferred humidity? Below 40%, I assume. This is a classic dry-defensive response. We've seen it before. We have a pamphlet.

Has Claudette been banned from any organizations? +

Claudette has been asked to leave the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM), two Marriott properties, and the city of Tucson. She considers each a badge of honor. Tucson is, in her words, "a moral desert in every sense."
